1: <sup>1</sup> Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
2: <sup>2</sup> For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
3: <sup>3</sup> For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
4: <sup>4</sup> He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
5: <sup>5</sup> Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
6: <sup>6</sup> Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
7: <sup>7</sup> Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
8: <sup>8</sup> Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
9: <sup>9</sup> She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
10: <sup>10</sup> Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
11: <sup>11</sup> I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
12: <sup>12</sup> When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
13: <sup>13</sup> Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
14: <sup>14</sup> Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
15: <sup>15</sup> Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
16: <sup>16</sup> For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
17: <sup>17</sup> For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
18: <sup>18</sup> But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
19: <sup>19</sup> The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
20: <sup>20</sup> My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
21: <sup>21</sup> Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
22: <sup>22</sup> For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
23: <sup>23</sup> Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
24: <sup>24</sup> Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
25: <sup>25</sup> Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
26: <sup>26</sup> Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
27: <sup>27</sup> Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
